isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HEATER CORE - FRONT HVAC SYSTEM

svcprocinfo.para: Access to the heater hoses may require the removal of nearby assemblies. The assemblies that must be removed vary by vehicle model and engine combinations. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

note.para: Refer to Figure 39 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

step1.para: Drain engine coolant from heater core and connected heater lines. Refer to the appropriate COOLING section in GROUP 12 of the Master Service Manual.

note.para: Before removing heater hoses in the following step, label hoses to insure correct installation.

step1.para: Disconnect both heater hoses (2, Figure 39) from heater core tubes on engine side of cowl.

From inside cab, remove blower scroll housing. Refer to BLOWER SCROLL HOUSING, REMOVE AND INSTALL
.

note.para: The heater core is mounted at a slight angle and therefore retains a small amount of coolant in the core. Be careful to keep the core in an upright position until the coolant can be drained.

step1.para: Pull heater core (5) out of heater housing (6).

note.para: In the following step insure that the heater housing seal that surrounds the heater core tubes does not become dislodged while installing the heater core.

step1.para: From inside cab, carefully position heater core (5, Figure 39) in heater housing (6) so that tube ends of core protrude through dash panel seal (7).

Install blower scroll housing (4) and heater trim panel. Refer to BLOWER SCROLL HOUSING, REMOVE AND INSTALL
.

note.para: In the following step position the heater hose clamps to allow easy access for their next removal.

step1.para: On engine side of cowl, install heater hoses (2) and clamps.
Fill cooling system with coolant. Refer to the appropriate COOLING section in GROUP 12 of the Master Service Manual, or the Operator Manual supplied with the vehicle.

note.para: Verify that coolant system is leak-free before proceeding to the following steps.
